intro: Staphidium agreste, commonly known as the wild staphidium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Staphidium agreste is an important component of the flora in its native range, contributing to ecological diversity and supporting pollinators.
